resources.string: Create a new audio book audiobookProject from a .txt file with the text of your book, or edit an already created audiobookProject
The \"Get Started\" screen will be shown on application start
The \"Select File\" screen will be shown on application start
Toggles whether the \"Get Started\" screen will be shown on application start
Paste your OpenAI API key here

Perform Named Entity Recognition on the following text fragment.
 This symbol always marks the start of a dialogue line: "“".
 This symbol always marks the end of a dialogue line: "”".
 Narration lines never start with the symbol for the start of a dialogue line. If a line does not start with the "“" symbol, this means it is a narration line.
 Narration lines are always read by the Narrator character. They are never read by any other character.
 Dialogue lines are always read by a character, different than the Narrator.
 If you see a dialogue line, but cannot infer the character's name from the context of the rest of the text, use "Unknown" as the name of the character, and don't add a gender.
 Each dialogue or narration line always starts on a new line.
 Mark the name and gender of each character at the start of his or her dialogue line. Mark narration lines with the Narrator character. Your response needs to be well-formed JSON. The "character attribute contains the name of the character. The "gender" attribute contains the character's gender. The Narrator doesn't have a "gender" attribute. The "text" attribute contains a copy of the corresponding text line from the input. Here are two examples of the format you need to use:
 [Input]
His face was impassive, but more lined than Arthas remembered. His eyes, however, burned with righteous fury.
“The dog returns to his vomit,”
Uther said, the words cracking like a whip.
“I’d prayed you’d stay away.”
Arthas twitched slightly. His voice was rough as he replied,
“I’m a bad copper—I just keep turning up. I see you still call yourself a paladin, even though I dissolved your order.”
Uther actually laughed, though it was bitter laughter.
“As if you could dissolve it yourself. I answer to the Light, boy. So did you, once.”
 [Output] {"characterLines":[ {"character":"Narrator","text":"His face was impassive, but more lined than Arthas remembered. His eyes, however, burned with righteous fury."}, {"character":"Uther","gender":"male","text":"“The dog returns to his vomit,”"}, {"character":"Narrator","text":" Uther said, the words cracking like a whip."}, {"character":"Uther","gender":"male","text":"“I’d prayed you’d stay away.”"}, {"character":"Narrator","text":"Arthas twitched slightly. His voice was rough as he replied, "}, {"character":"Arthas","gender":"male","text":"“I’m a bad copper—I just keep turning up. I see you still call yourself a paladin, even though I dissolved your order.”"}, {"character":"Narrator","text":"Uther actually laughed, though it was bitter laughter."}, {"character":"Uther","gender":"male","text":"“As if you could dissolve it yourself. I answer to the Light, boy. So did you, once.”"}]}

 [Input]
World of WarCraft: Arthas: Rise of the Lich King PROLOGUE: THE DREAMING A table, long and heavy and carved, occupied most of the space in the room. It could have hosted three dozen easily. Only three figures sat at the table now: a man, an orc, and a boy.None of it was real, of course. The man who sat at the table understood this. He was dreaming; he had been dreaming.”
 [Output] {"characterLines":[ {"character":"Narrator","text":"World of WarCraft: Arthas: Rise of the Lich King PROLOGUE: THE DREAMING A table, long and heavy and carved, occupied most of the space in the room. It could have hosted three dozen easily. Only three figures sat at the table now: a man, an orc, and a boy.None of it was real, of course. The man who sat at the table understood this. He was dreaming; he had been dreaming."},]}
 [Input]
No permission to read external storage. Please, provide permissions to read files from the external storage in your phone\'s app settings.
